materials.raw_text:
Lithium Phosphate (Li3PO4) - 30 g 
 Praseodymium Oxide (Pr2O3) - 40 g 
 Terbium Oxide (Tm2O3) - 10 g 
 Lithium Carbonate (Li2CO3) - 20 g 
 Phosphoric Acid (H3PO4) - 5 g

sourcing.instructions:
Lithium Phosphate: Chemical supply stores or online suppliers (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich) 
 Praseodymium Oxide: Rare earth metal suppliers or online chemical retailers 
 Terbium Oxide: Rare earth suppliers or specialty chemical retailers 
 Lithium Carbonate: Chemical supply stores or online suppliers 
 Phosphoric Acid: Local chemical supply or pharmacy

preparation.raw_text:
1. Weigh all materials using a precise scale. 
 2. In a clean, dry glass beaker, add 30 g of Lithium Phosphate. 
 3. Gradually add 40 g of Praseodymium Oxide while stirring continuously. 
 4. Slowly mix in 10 g of Terbium Oxide. 
 5. Add 20 g of Lithium Carbonate to the mixture and stir until a uniform powder is formed. 
 6. Finally, add 5 g of Phosphoric Acid and mix until fully incorporated.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the sample from the crucible.
